sentences.en: Clearly, the police cannot break the law in order to enforce it.
sentences.cn: 显然，警方不能为了执法而犯法。

sentences.en: Desegregation may be harder to enforce in rural areas.
sentences.cn: 要废除农村地区的种族隔离可能会更困难一些。

sentences.en: Enforce all rules and procedures for manufacturing quality, safety, environmental working conditions.
sentences.cn: 执行所有的质量 、 安全 、 工作环境条件方面的规则和程式.

sentences.en: He'd been mandated by the West African Economic Community to go in and to enforce a ceasefire.
sentences.cn: 他受西非经济共同体的委托介入并执行停火协定。

sentences.en: Is there any need to enforce that commandment by violence?
sentences.cn: 难道实行这条诫命还需要使用暴力 吗 ?

sentences.en: It is unlikely that a record company would enforce its views on an established artist.
sentences.cn: 唱片公司未必能强迫一位已出名的艺人接受他们的意见。

sentences.en: It's the job of the police to enforce the law.
Match officials should not tolerate such behaviour but instead enforce the laws of the game.
sentences.cn: 赛事官员不应纵容这种行为，而应严格执行比赛规则。

sentences.en: Parking restrictions will be strictly enforced.
sentences.cn: 停车限制将会严格执行。

sentences.en: Policetmen and judges enforce the laws.
That rules look fine on paper but are difficult to enforce.
sentences.cn: 这一规定表面看来很合理但付诸实施仍有困难.

sentences.en: The new sheriff decided to enforce the law with rigour.
The police don't make the laws, they merely enforce them.
sentences.cn: 警察并不制定法律，只是负责执行。

sentences.en: The teacher will enforce the rules of the school.
sentences.cn: 教师要厉行学校的规则.

sentences.en: They have no means, short of civil war, to enforce their will upon the minorities.
sentences.cn: 他们只有通过内战才能将意志强加给少数派。

sentences.en: You have no right to enforce your own views on me.
sentences.cn: 你无权把你自己的观点强加给我.

words.tran_cn: 可实施的；可强行的；可强迫的

trans.tran_en: to make people obey a rule or law

trans.tran_cn: 实施， 生效， 执行； 强迫， 迫使
trans.tran_en: to make people obey a rule or law
